com.ethercis.ehr.building

Class ContentBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ethercis.ehr.building.ContentBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I_ContentBuilder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OetContentBuilder, OptContentBuilder

    public abstract class ContentBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements I_ContentBuilder
    Abstract class to manage the content of a composition (an Entry) under its serialized representation. At this point in time, the serialization is using the value tree (Maps and Arrays) as a JSON structure. Created by C. Chevalley on 4/3/2015.

      • importCanonicalXML

        public org.openehr.rm.composition.Composition importCanonicalXML(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        import an XML representation of a standard RM composition The composition is intended then to be stored in the DB, as it does not contains any constraints
        The import is induced by creating a Contribution containing a number of Compositions. Hence the use case would be:
        • import the XML string and generate the corresponding RM composition
        • save the composition into the DB
        • retrieve the composition as required. At this stage the composition is created with constraints
        The Content instance contains this composition alongwith the value map (json) and other attributes
        Specified by:
        importCanonicalXML in interface I_ContentBuilder
        Parameters:
        inputStream - an input stream to read the XML representation
        Returns:
        an RM composition
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Composition

      • exportCanonicalXML

        public byte[] exportCanonicalXML(org.openehr.rm.composition.Composition composition,
                                 boolean prettyPrint)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        serialize a composition using XmlBeans (e.g. Canonical XML)

        NB: serialization using XStream does not yield an XML representation compatible with XmlBeans schema...

        Specified by:
        exportCanonicalXML in interface I_ContentBuilder
        Parameters:
        composition - an RM composition
        prettyPrint - true if indented Xml is wanted
        Returns:
        byte array representing the resulting Xml String
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
